communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FCC Complaints: 2024 VMA Awards
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All complaints about the 2024 Video Music Awards broadcasted on MTV for the time period Sept. 10, 2024 - Oct. 10, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kyra Fields

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Ethel Kennedy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records, specifically those unreleased, mentioning or describing Ethel Kennedy (born: April 11, 1928; died Oct. 10, 2024). She was the wife of Senator Robert F. Kennedy and sister-in-law of former President John F. Kennedy. Her birth name was Ethel Skakel. 

Her death was widely covered by the press: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/10/us/politics/ethel-kennedy-dead.html

https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2024/10/10/ethel-kennedy-robert-kennedy-dies/75606607007/

https://apnews.com/article/ethel-kennedy-dies-00eb88951db24e0cada9bd48b66ad8ea

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. Please search HQ records as well as ALL field offices and resident agencies.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, and am currently a reporter of The Boston Globe.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Employee recruitment and census
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. The recruitment information (job posting, recruiting agency contracts, job advertisements) for the 2024 recruitment of the Village Administrator position.

2. The applications for that position including resumes.

3. All scoring guides, notes, emails, matrixes, votes regarding the candidates and the final decision of village administrator. 

4. The resume of the current village administrator.

5.Current employee census with headcount, names, salaries.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daelon

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Arrest of Collin Griffith
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

The files that I am requesting are all related to the arrest of Collin Griffith, the 17 year old teenager who was arrested on September 8, 2024 after murdering his mother Catherine Griffith in Auburndale.
I am requesting the following files; the interrogation video footage of Collin Griffith that is in relation to his arrest on September 8, 2024 by the Polk County Sheriff's Office, Bodycam footage of his arrest, as well as 9-1-1 Call recordings that are related to the arrest of Collin Griffith on September 8, 2024.
These are the only files that I am requesting.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Rebin Osman

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Alabama Negotiations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request any and all documents, including written communications between Department of Justice staff and those of the State of Alabama and the Alabama Department of Corrections, related to the negotiations, occurring "over 20 months", as identified within the December 9th, 2020 Press Release by the U.S. Attorney's Office, Northern District of Alabama (see: https://www.justice.gov/usao-ndal/pr/justice-department-files-lawsuit-against-state-alabama-unconstitutional-conditions-0). As described within the aforementioned press release, these negotiations occurred between the U.S. Department of Justice and the State of Alabama (including the Alabama Department of Corrections).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

title: Alexander Elliot Anderson Salmond (31 December 1954 – 12 October 2024)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Alexander Elliot Anderson Salmond (31 December 1954 – 12 October 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former First Minister of Scotland and Scottish National Party leader Alexander Elliot Anderson Salmond (31 December 1954 – 12 October 2024). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example,  you may find his BBC obituary at the following link: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/cd13102l9g5o

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR)
Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and
all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies
and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs
and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center
to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is
not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously
released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of
those records while additional records are located and processed for release.
If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to
review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive
documents, as the FOIA requires. I request that I be properly classified as a
media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written
numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these
documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any
questions about my media status. The requested documents will be made
available to the general public, and this request is not being made for
commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if
you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.
I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if
available or CD-ROM if not. Thank you in advance for your anticipated
cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this
request within 20 business days, as the statute requires. Sincerely, Matthew
Petti

Supporting documentation

**

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Related to Maryland Code §11-801, which permits counties to impose fees on "weekend incarcerated individuals"; specifically:  

1. The per diem rate, or daily charge, of the weekend incarceration fee imposed in the county detention/correctional facility both currently and in FY23.
2. The daily “average cost of providing food, lodging, and clothing for an incarcerated individual” in the county detention/correctional facility used to calculate the weekend incarceration fee in FY23.
3. The total number of individuals charged the weekend incarceration fee in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23. 
4. The total amount of fees collected from weekend incarcerated individuals in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23.
5. All policies and procedures regarding the imposition and collection of the weekend incarceration fee, including but not limited to guidelines on how these fees are determined and collected in the county detention/correctional facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly Stevenson
